title: Ticket #7771: Support spooled submits with the Submit object
description:
The old Schedd.submit interface supports spooled submits, but the new Submit.queue interface does not. It should.

API changes:

  • The Submit.queue and Submit.queue_with_itemdata methods both need a spool keyword argument that defaults to False.
  • We need to expose the SubmitResult method for capturing ad_results, which TJ says exists, but is not public.

Internals: whatever TJ says to do.

The above is slightly a lie... it does kind of support it, but you have to do all the work manually... 

TEN_DAYS = 60 * 60 * 24 * 10
COMPLETION_DATE = "CompletionDate"

sub = htcondor.Submit(
    {
        "executable": "/bin/cat",
        "arguments": "README.md",
        "transfer_input_files": "README.md",
        "output": "test.out",
        "error": "test.err",
        "held": "true",
        "My.HoldReason": classad.quote("Spooling input files"),
        "My.HoldReasonCode": "16",
        "My.LeaveJobInQueue": "true",
        "transfer_output_remaps": classad.quote(
            "_condor_stdout=test.out ; _condor_stderr=test.err"
        ),
    }
)

schedd = htcondor.Schedd()

ads = []
with schedd.transaction() as txn:
    result = sub.queue(txn, ad_results=ads)

schedd.spool(ads)

... and then later calling schedd.retrieve. Obviously we don't want to make users have to add so much nonsense to their submit descriptions.
